text:
TypeScript 5.1 is now out! Now with:

- smarter checks for undefined-returning functions
- no restrictions between getter/setter types
- better checks against JSX tags
- linked editing for JSX
- @‚Å†param snippets
- new speed-ups

Read up more on our blog!

https://t.co/7M0r2cbJIA

text:
TypeScript 5.1 Beta is now available to try, with

- smarter checks for undefined-returning functions
- no restrictions between getter/setter types
- customizable tag checks for JSX libraries
- linked editing for JSX
- @‚Å†param snippets

and more!

https://t.co/UjXm9TO5GO

text:
This is cool.
TS-Pattern is faster than most people think, and it's unlikely for code branching to be the perf bottleneck of your app, but compiling its runtime away is an interesting idea for perf critical code. Thank you for exploring this path @aidenybai & @zack_overflow!

quoted_tweet.text:
Introducing üéÇ pattycake

An optimizing compiler for ts-pattern for 10x faster performance 

Now, you have your cake (expressive pattern matching), and eat it too (zero runtime overhead).

Setup in <5 minutes: https://t.co/VB4GSIOWyt https://t.co/nNAe3vUBXA

mediaDetails.ext_alt_text: zero runtime pattern matching for everything

photos.accessibilityLabel: zero runtime pattern matching for everything

text: This 17y old kids built a Discord for developers https://t.co/dXzU4krYa6
quick shoutout to @buildergroop members for always hyping up + repping my wallpapers. can't express how much it means https://t.co/teV2lx263L

we put five thousand teenagers in a discord server for over a year at @buildergroop 

here's a megathread of our top funny (mostly stupid) moments https://t.co/y8kfkjXnt9

happy happy happy birthday to @suptejas, my friend and co-founder ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥

mindbogglingly talented, driven, and wise for your years - I can hardly imagine where you'll be tomorrow, let alone next year. cheers to an amazing 17th year!

Sooo, you can return React components, even with translated content from Server Actions? ‚ú®

Seems really promising, e.g. for lazy loading paginated lists. Would be curious though, if there's a way to cache the returned response since Server Actions use a POST request. https://t.co/XMvG3Mzhy4

text:
Voidpet is half game, half mental health app

We picked the health & fitness category thinking it would be less competitive/easier to rank

This turned out to be true on Android and false on iOS

For several months we've gotten 10x more downloads from random people finding the‚Ä¶ https://t.co/OCbLtYyyQS
darn, looks like I‚Äôm destined for jail https://t.co/r8S7GB1st0

https://t.co/CcfpFjmFPB

I get a bunch of 3d coordinates and velocities for hailstones, and have to find how they interact. sympy saves part 2.

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 22: "Sand Slabs"

https://t.co/44i25Ykmu8

Each of 1500 lines has two x,y,z coordinates for a block falling through space. I have to let them all fall, and the figure out how others fall when blocks are removed.

text:
The Microsoft Excel Championship wrapped in Las Vegas last weekend.

Andrew ‚ÄúThe Annihilator‚Äù Ngai won his 3rd straight title.

The Australian actuary beat 14 opponents in various 30-minute case study challenges.

Funniest part: this clip of live-stream announcers losing their‚Ä¶ https://t.co/CwYtyl2QS4

#AdventOfCode Day 11: "Cosmic Expansion"

https://t.co/J7xDbmr0kI

I get a grid with galaxies, and I need to calculate the distance between them. The twist is that empty rows and columns count for more space.
